qas.question: When was the new Government seated in CAR?
What did the former opposition parties declare?
Who was refused as new president?
Who would rule the country temporarily?
How long did the parliament have until the next election?

plausible_answers.text: members of Séléka and representatives of the opposition to Bozizé, one pro-Bozizé individual, and a number representatives of civil society

qas.question: What groups does the transient parliament consist of?
What did Djotodia say he would boycott on March 31 2013?
Who did members of Seleka refuse to recognize?
What was signed by African leaders in Chad on April 6th?

context: <b5_0>A new government<b5_0/> was appointed on <a0_0>31 March 2013<a0_0/>, which consisted of <b6_0>members of Séléka and representatives of the opposition to Bozizé, one pro-Bozizé individual, and a number representatives of civil society<b6_0/>. On 1 April, the former opposition parties declared that they would <a1_0>boycott <b7_0>the government<b7_0/><a1_0/>. After African leaders in Chad refused to recognize <a2_0><b8_0>Djotodia<a2_0/> as President<b8_0/>, proposing to form a transitional council and the holding of new elections, Djotodia signed <b9_0>a decree<b9_0/> on 6 April for the formation of a council that would act as <a3_0>a transitional parliament<a3_0/>. The council was tasked with electing a president to serve prior to elections in <a4_0>18 months<a4_0/>.
